channel.title: Best way of Communicating
channel.description:
Hey hey, I am currently working on a SCAR plugin that allows interface with the Runescape (Like XScar). My problem is, I dont know the best way of doing this. There are a few options:
1.Just use a file (SCAR sends a request by editing a file, which the client reads, and then inputs a reply to) Problem with this is that a) Its pretty slow (Takes 0.5 - 1 seconds for a to send a request and then receive response, b) Takes up alot of Processor power (Thread in Java must be continually checking file for requests) and c) SCAR doesnt have Exception Handling, so if both SCAR and java try to access the file at the same time, SCAR crashes :(
2. Write a plugin for SCAR that makes use of the JNI ( So basically SCAR can call java functions) This is the fastest way I know of, but it will be a pain to learn delphi -.-
3. Some other ultra-smart idea.
Please post your ideas\suggestions - they are much appreciated.
-Iamadam

item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Thanks heaps

item.title: Best way of Communicating
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Thanks alot guys I was using the file writing and it was reallly bad - did the job but it wasted so many resources and it was slooow
Can ya post that stuff Mopar?
(This looks like it may be easier than I first thought ;))[br][size=1]Posted at: May 15, 2006, 05:38:02 pm[/size][hr]I still need that stuff lol - engine changes don’t stop me
If ya can’t find it then don’t worry about it

Read full topic

item.title: Best way of Communicating
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I would go with krichevskoy’s method #2, the shared memory api RegeX wrote so you can communicate with java via SCAR’s sendinterscarmessage() and receiveinterscarmessage() (names probably arent right, cause I havent done it for awhile) I even have the basic framework of a bot written to be SCAR scriptable that I stopped work on a long time ago, if you want RegeX’s stuff to do this I can get it off my desktop computer and post in here in a few days.

Read full topic

item.title: Best way of Communicating
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

At the moment I can remember two things that people have done in the past:

  1. vortex’s local web server in Java (SCAR makes requests like http://localhost/vars?=currenthp)
  2. RegeX’s shared memory thingy

The file writing is not a good way to do it
You could also perhaps use JNI

Read full topic
